title: [Large-Scale] Learner-Centered Distance Language Education Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language proficiency and fundamental digital device usage skills
context.additional_context: Blended learning model operating in smartphone-centric limited technology environments, applying pedagogical approaches combining offline classes with mobile-linked assignments

learning_goals: Learners can engage in peer interaction activities twice weekly via a mobile platform.
Learners can self-diagnose language proficiency and create improvement plans using digital content and real-time feedback.
Learners complete real-time surveys and collaborative tasks using smartphones during offline classes with over 80% accuracy.
Learners submit mobile-based language practice assignments for four weeks with over 90% completion and incorporate peer evaluation feedback.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
